title: Nat Silcock Jr.
text:
Nathan "Nat" Douglas Silcock (25 November 1927 – 7 July 1992) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1940s, 1950s and 1960s, and <a href="Coach%20%28sport%29">coach</a>ed in the 1960s. He played at representative level for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a>, <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>, <a href="Rugby%20League%20XIII">Rugby League XIII</a>, <a href="Rugby%20League%20War%20of%20the%20Roses">Lancashire</a>, and Australia's <a href="Newcastle%20rugby%20league%20team">Newcastle team</a>, and at club level for <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>, <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a>, <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a>, <a href="Newcastle%20Rugby%20League">South Newcastle</a> and <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Eastern Suburbs</a>, as a , or , i.e. number 2 or 5, 8 or 10, or, 11 or 12, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s, and coached at club level for <a href="Newcastle%20Rugby%20League">South Newcastle</a> and <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Eastern Suburbs</a>.
Background.
Nat Silcock was born in <a href="Widnes">Widnes</a>, <a href="Lancashire">Lancashire</a>, England, he was the son of the rugby league footballer; <a href="Nat%20Silcock%20Sr.">Nat Silcock Sr.</a>, and he died aged 64 in <a href="Penketh">Penketh</a>, <a href="Lancashire">Lancashire</a>, England.
Playing career.
England.
Wigan.
Silcock played in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s 16-11 victory over <a href="Australia%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Australia</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Wednesday 20 October 1948. Silcock played in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s 14-8 victory over <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> in the <a href="1948%E2%80%9349%20Lancashire%20Cup">1948–49</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1948%E2%80%9349%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1948–49 season</a> at <a href="Station%20Road%2C%20Swinton">Station Road, Swinton</a> on Saturday 13 November 1948. Silcock played , and scored a <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a> in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s 20-2 victory over <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1949%E2%80%9350%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1949–50 season</a> at <a href="Maine%20Road">Maine Road</a>, Manchester on Saturday 13 May 1950.
Silcock played , and scored 3-<a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">tries</a> in the 49-28 victory over <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Italy</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Saturday 26 August 1950. He played right-, i.e. number 12, in the 28-5 victory over <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> in the <a href="1950%E2%80%9351%20Lancashire%20Cup">1950–51</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1950%E2%80%9351%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1950–51 season</a> at <a href="Station%20Road%2C%20Swinton">Station Road, Swinton</a> on Saturday 4 November 1950. Silcock played in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s victories in the <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20League">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20leagues">County League</a> during the <a href="1949%E2%80%9350%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1949–50 season</a> and <a href="1951%E2%80%9352%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1951–52 season</a>. Silcock played left-, i.e. number 11, in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s 10-0 victory over <a href="Barrow%20Raiders">Barrow</a> in the <a href="1950%E2%80%9351%20Challenge%20Cup">1950–51</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1950%E2%80%9351%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1950–51 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 5 May 1951. He played in the 14-6 victory over <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh</a> in the <a href="1951%E2%80%9352%20Lancashire%20Cup">1951–52</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1951%E2%80%9352%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1951–52 season</a> at <a href="Station%20Road%2C%20Swinton">Station Road, Swinton</a> on Saturday 27 October 1951. Silcock was also selected to play for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> in 1951 against <a href="Other%20Nationalities%20rugby%20league%20team">Other Nationalities</a>. He also played , and scored a <a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a> in the 13-6 victory over <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1951%E2%80%9352%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1951–52 season</a> at <a href="Leeds%20Road">Leeds Road</a>, <a href="Huddersfield">Huddersfield</a> on Saturday 10 May 1952. Silcock was selected to play for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> in 1952 against <a href="Other%20Nationalities%20rugby%20league%20team">Other Nationalities</a>.
Silcock was selected to play for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while in 1953 against <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a>. Silcock played right-, i.e. number 10, in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s 8-16 defeat by <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> in the <a href="1953%E2%80%9354%20Lancashire%20Cup">1953–54</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1953%E2%80%9354%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1953–54 season</a> at <a href="Station%20Road%2C%20Swinton">Station Road, Swinton</a> on Saturday 24 October 1953. He also won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="Great%20Britain%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Great Britain</a> in 1954 against Australia (3 matches).
St Helens.
Silcock played right-, i.e. number 10, in <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a>' 13-2 victory over <a href="Halifax%20R.L.F.C.">Halifax</a> in the <a href="1956%20Challenge%20Cup">1956</a> <a href="Challenge%20Cup">Challenge Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1955%E2%80%9356%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1955–56 season</a> at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium%20%281923%29">Wembley Stadium</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Saturday 28 April 1956, in front of a crowd of 79,341, and played right- in the 3-10 defeat by <a href="Oldham%20R.L.F.C.">Oldham</a> in the <a href="1956%E2%80%9357%20Lancashire%20Cup">1956–57</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1956%E2%80%9357%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1956–57 season</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Saturday 20 October 1956, in front of a crowd of 39,544.
Warrington.
Silcock played for <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> from September 1958 to April 1961. Silcock played in <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a>'s 5-4 victory over <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St. Helens</a> in the <a href="1959%E2%80%9360%20Lancashire%20Cup">1959–60</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1959%E2%80%9360%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1959–60 season</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Saturday 31 October 1959, in front of a crowd of 39,237.
Australia.
Newcastle.
Silcock travelled to Australia to play in the <a href="Newcastle%20Rugby%20League">Newcastle Rugby League</a> for the South Newcastle club from 1961 to 1964. In 2010 Silcock was named in a South Newcastle team of the century.
Sydney.
Silcock moved to Sydney's <a href="New%20South%20Wales%20Rugby%20Football%20League">New South Wales Rugby Football League</a> to captain-coach <a href="Sydney%20Roosters">Eastern Suburbs club</a> for the <a href="1964%20NSWRFL%20Premiership">1964 NSWRFL Premiership</a> season.
Genealogical information.
Nat Silcock's marriage to Zelma P. (<a href="Given%20name%23Name%20at%20birth">née</a> Roocroft) was registered during third ¼ 1952 in <a href="Prescot">Prescot</a> district. They had children; Sandra P. Silcock (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3DJgDoQS9nhw9v4g1316i71A%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> second ¼ in <a href="Prescot">Prescot</a> district) and Karl N. D. Silcock 1966
